publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1920 Robert Brown: British Council Scotland and International Education Week—That the Parliament acknowledges the importance of international projects and activities that are taking place in schools, universities and colleges across Scotland; recognises that an international dimension in the curriculum enhances the quality, variety and relevance of education and acknowledges its contribution to the professional development of teachers, and welcomes the British Council Scotland’s information stand highlighting these activities which will be in the garden lobby of Holyrood on 16 and 17 November 2004 and the Scottish Executive’s annual international education conference in Victoria Quay on 23 November 2004, both of which are taking place during International Education Week.
S2M-1920 British Council Scotland and International Education Week (lodged on 29 October 2004) Nora Radcliffe*, Eleanor Scott*, Robin Harper*, Mike Pringle*
S2M-1920 British Council Scotland and International Education Week (lodged on 29 October 2004) Alex Neil*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Karen Gillon*
S2M-1920 British Council Scotland and International Education Week (lodged on 29 October 2004) Trish Godman*, Donald Gorrie*, Marlyn Glen*, Susan Deacon*
S2M-1920 British Council Scotland and International Education Week (lodged on 29 October 2004) Marilyn Livingstone*
S2M-1920 British Council Scotland and International Education Week (lodged on 29 October 2004) Cathy Peattie*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-1920 British Council Scotland and International Education Week (lodged on 29 October 2004) Pauline McNeill*
S2M-1920 British Council Scotland and International Education Week (lodged on 29 October 2004) Des McNulty*
S2M-1920 British Council Scotland and International Education Week (lodged on 29 October 2004) John Scott*
S2M-1920 British Council Scotland and International Education Week (lodged on 29 October 2004) Alasdair Morgan*
S2M-1920 British Council Scotland and International Education Week (lodged on 29 October 2004) Bill Butler*
S2M-1920 British Council Scotland and International Education Week (lodged on 29 October 2004) Mr John Swinney*
